recipe.title: How to Cook Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts

procedure.summary: Pound and season the chicken breasts.
procedure.description: Get out one to four boneless, skinless chicken breasts and set them on a cutting board. Use a rolling pin or the bottom of a heavy bottle to pound the chicken breasts until they're an even thickness. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and freshly ground pepper. You can flatten the chicken breasts as thin as you like. Keep in mind that they'll cook faster if they're thinner.

procedure.summary: Heat the oil and cook the chicken breasts for one minute.
procedure.description: Place 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of olive oil or unsalted butter into a wide sauté pan that's at least 10 inches (25 cm) in size. Turn the heat to medium-high and add the chicken breasts to the pan. Cook the chicken for one minute without moving it.

procedure.summary: Turn the chicken breasts and reduce the heat.
procedure.description: Use tongs or a spatula to flip the chicken breasts over. Turn the heat down to low and continue to cook the chicken breasts.

procedure.summary: Cover and cook the chicken for 10 minutes.
procedure.description: Put a tight-fitting lid on the pan and cook the chicken breasts for 10 minutes without lifting the lid at all. The chicken breasts should steam a little in the pan during this time.

procedure.summary: Turn off the heat and rest the chicken for 10 minutes.
procedure.description: Leave the lid on the pan and don't open it while the chicken rests. It should finish cooking as it rests for 10 minutes. If you have an electric stove, move the pan to a cold burner so the chicken won't overcook.

procedure.summary: Check the temperature and serve the chicken breasts.
procedure.description: Take the lid off of the pan and insert an instant-read thermometer into one of the breasts. The temperature should reach 165 °F (74 °C) once the chicken has finished cooking. If the chicken hasn't finished cooking, turn the heat on to medium and sauté the chicken breasts for a few more minutes. Check the temperature again.

procedure.summary: Serve or store the chicken breasts.
procedure.description: Once the chicken has come to temperature, lift the breasts out of the pan and serve or slice them. You can store the leftover chicken breasts in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three to five days.
